03_central_limit_theorem/02_normal/08_x_from_rightarea_v1

Random variable \(C\) is normally distributed with mean \(\mu = 480\) and standard deviation \(\sigma = 150\). \[C = \text{N}(480,\,150) \] Evaluate \(c\) such that \(P(C>c) = 0.73\). In other words, determine an lower boundary such that a normal spinner with mean 480 and standard deviation 150 lands over that boundary 73% of the time.
